title: Clathromangelia strigilata
text:
Clathromangelia strigilata is a species of <a href="sea%20snail">sea snail</a>, a marine <a href="gastropod">gastropod</a> <a href="mollusk">mollusk</a> in the <a href="family%20%28biology%29">family</a> <a href="Raphitomidae">Raphitomidae</a>.
Description.
The white, slightly translucent fusiform <a href="Gastropod%20shell">shell</a> has convex <a href="Whorl%20%28mollusc%29">whorls</a> with prominent, longitudinal costae about the whole length and sloping, equidistant striae. The shell grows to a length of 4 mm to 5 mm. The oblong <a href="Aperture%20%28mollusc%29">aperture</a> is somewhat rounded and its length is slightly less than the total length of the shell. The <a href="siphonal%20canal">siphonal canal</a> is wide open. The <a href="Columella%20%28gastropod%29">columella</a> is slightly inclined to the left. The outer lip is not dentate and is inclined inwards with below a shallow anal sinus.
Distribution.
This species is found in the Mediterranean Sea in the <a href="Gulf%20of%20Gab%C3%A8s">Gulf of Gabès</a>, Tunisia.
